website_summaries.verdict: A very good guide to general weightlifting combined with nutrition to achieve strength gains and weight loss, aimed squarely at novice to intermediate weightlifters.
pros: Presents classic body building concepts in an engaging package that can inspire novice to intermediate lifters to get better gains
Combines workout plans with nutrition guide
cons: May be too complex for beginning lifters, and too simple for seasoned athletes
Older lifters may want to supplement this book with a wider range of material

customer_reviews.title: At the risk of being dramatic, this book and ...
customer_reviews.text: At the risk of being dramatic, this book and its author's online content basically changed my life. By opening my eyes and showing me just how simple (I said simple, not easy) weight loss is if you put in the work and practice some willpower. Using the methods in this book, i was able to lose 109 lbs and as of today have maintained this body for 2 years now. At the age of 41 mind you. My outlook on life has changed DRASTICALLY over these 2 years and a large part of it is due to this book. Thank you, Mike. From the bottom of my heart! I wish you much success in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Not worthy of a garage sale .10 cent book.
customer_reviews.text: At 62 years old I have been through various training programs. I had just started exercising again after being out of the gym for 2 years. I was so excited about just enjoying the gym experience and doing exercises that made me feel stronger but this book set me back so far that I even began to feel depressed about not being able to do this heavy lifting program. After chapter 9 trash became the book and I’m feeling great again. Sorry man but your book is depressing! I wish you well in whatever else you do with your life but a scam book job is just not career worthy. Get a real job.
customer_reviews.author: gman

customer_reviews.title: Bro - Science
customer_reviews.text: Just because you read a study on one instance to support your argument, does not imply your argument is true. The author obsesses over calories in and calories out, when there are many many studies suggesting calories are not the core weight gainer but rather hormones. This book is just written like a high school student.
customer_reviews.author: SP

customer_reviews.title: More of the same...
customer_reviews.text: Nothing new here. His big secret, do strength training. This guy never shuts up. Honestly this could have been a pamphlet. Lots of words and no new information. This one's going back!
customer_reviews.author: Todd

customer_reviews.title: Nothing New Here
customer_reviews.text: Brass Tacks: Eat sensibly, add incrementally weight to your lifting routine and don't overdo anything. Author is not reinventing the Workout Wheel.
customer_reviews.author: Corey M.

customer_reviews.title: Way too bloated. Nothing new.
customer_reviews.text: No new information here. There are plenty of free YouTube channels that provide the same and more. Book could've been cut by at least 50-60% lots of marketing and self hype. Not worth it at all.
customer_reviews.author: Isaac Ra

customer_reviews.title: another book with no content
customer_reviews.text: Just full of a lot of big words. too confusing.. Meals are all complicated with exotic supplies. Too bad no one can come up with a diet that just uses simple readily available ingredients.
customer_reviews.author: SamHain

customer_reviews.title: Not for bodybuilding
customer_reviews.text: I made a mistake. Bought it as a body building development guide and it is just general info about diets and selfconscience stuff. Sent it back without any inconvenience. Thank you Amazon
customer_reviews.author: juan

customer_reviews.title: Move on to something else
customer_reviews.text: Don’t waste your money. It’s a book about trying to motivate you with words. The lifting plan is caveman lifting. I read it and I wasted hours of my life, don’t do the same as I did.
customer_reviews.author: Casey Harris

customer_reviews.title: It's worth it
customer_reviews.text: I've been trying lots of things to get fit over the last year and finally found this book. It's the single most valuable resource I've found. It covers diet, exercise specifics, and the science behind body change. Mike has done us all a fantastic service in boiling it all down to the essentials in an easy-to-read summary. If you care about the health and strength of your body and you want to understand the best ways to improve and you actually want to MAKE IT HAPPEN, this is the book you need. Do not wait. Buy it now and start putting it into practice.
customer_reviews.author: Glade

customer_reviews.title: Infomercial in print
customer_reviews.text: Save your money and your time. It would be better spent doing a little research on Google. This is mostly fluff with little real substance
customer_reviews.author: BoroEagle

customer_reviews.title: If you have been in the gym and notice no gains over the years. This book will open your eyes to what you have been doing wrong
customer_reviews.text: Listening to Jeff Justice reading this amazing book on how Science is put first and not just best guesses. Mike Mathews really dives into why, what, where, when and how our body functions. He educates you first on breaking down all the myths and legends of all the workouts you have ever heard of. Then goes on to giving you a in depth description of each dictionary word that we may have heard in the fitness realm. Where we at last come to the best part of the book in my opinion is workouts and how to do them properly. A deep dive into a daily routine that will work for anyone from a novice to a professional weight lifter.
customer_reviews.author: david beers

customer_reviews.title: Mixed feelings about the book
customer_reviews.text: The movie the Game Changers 2018 clearly shows how Olympians and professional athletes can be vegetarian and thrive. I have mixed emotions on how he describes basically eating meat over vegetables. It does not include the fact that your blood type dictates whether you will wanna (need to) eat meat as being a blood type O or if your blood type A or a B you’re going to enjoy eating more vegetables and lean meats. It feels like the meat industry give him incentives to say eat more meat Which is calorie dense and overtime is bad for your brain, like liver and even more importantly heart disease.
customer_reviews.author: TOM J

customer_reviews.title: Not Impressed
customer_reviews.text: The first 40+ pages are self promotion and fluff. Finally got to the core content and can't say I was impressed. Way more hype than science.
customer_reviews.author: MN Outdoorsman

customer_reviews.title: This is what I've been looking for!
customer_reviews.text: I received more helpful info in this book than all the magazines in the last few years. I love that it's straight forward, clear and simple. This is exactly what I've been in search of and I wish I found this years ago. As soon as I changed my macros to the proper levels I could immediately feel my body reacting. Thank you, thank you, thank you for all the great info. I'm still a lil fat boy but I am so excited and recharged to push forward! End goal: Thor or Thanos for Halloween! (not the Endgame Thor :-P)
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Balsz

customer_reviews.title: Muscle-building advice that actually WORKS.
customer_reviews.text: Okay, I admit, I had doubts that a workout that hit each body part once a week would work. Figured that would be great for the genetically gifted and the chemically dependent. Guess what? It totally does work. The routine and diet plan will absolutely make a difference in the results you're getting at the gym -- okay, two weeks after you implement, you're obviously not gonna look like the Rock, but stick with it and you will be amazed at just how effective this program is. If you're serious about muscle building, do yourself a favor and buy and follow the advice in this tome. You won't be sorry.
customer_reviews.author: Sydney L. Cuthbert

customer_reviews.title: This book just rings true - it confirms all the things u already know in ur gut to be right and it also confirms all those thing
customer_reviews.text: You know how sometimes when u read something u just know it rings true even though u may not know all the details? This book just rings true - it confirms all the things u already know in ur gut to be right and it also confirms all those things that u know are bull or just a plain waste of time and money. Getting big isn't rocket science - u know you have to eat right, work out correctly, sleep and supplement. This book puts it all in one place so ur not wasting ur time and money. Just by this book and get started
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Informative and thorough
customer_reviews.text: The book contains a wealth of information about nutrition, physiology, muscle myths, and of course workouts. I confess that I couldn't follow the advice about long rest periods between sets: I got so bored waiting three minutes between sets that I didn't even get the endorphine rush that going to the gym usually provides for me. However, Matthews's emphasis on sets in the 4-to-6 rep range has paid off for me: In eight weeks I've put on a full inch around my upper arms and my quads and across my shoulders (breadth).
customer_reviews.author: Wayne

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Book!
customer_reviews.text: The knowledge in this book is awesome. Finally I really understand the exact relationship between eating right and weight lifting and cardio. All of it makes perfect sense. It is so refreshing to finally have a book that really explains it perfectly and an author who put his blood, sweat and tears into it and is happy to share it. I'm so happy to start my weight loss and weight lifting journey with my new found knowledge. If you want to finally understand it all then you need this book.
customer_reviews.author: Ginger Hudson

customer_reviews.title: I usually hate when book authors say "according to research
customer_reviews.text: This is a very well written book, only surpassed by the quality and extensive length of the author's research. I usually hate when book authors say "according to research.." but they never quote their sources. Every single claim that Matthews makes is backed up by a research paper or study and his sources are listed. There are very few claims not founded on research but those are clearly stated and usually are conclusions based on his own observations. One drawback of the book: it will ruing your reading of any other book on similar subjects because you will probably not find the same level of research.
customer_reviews.author: Genaro Salierno

customer_reviews.title: Alright.
customer_reviews.text: Good book,if you are a beginner just starting his fitness journey.I have already done a significant amount prior to reading this.and it just line out the basics eat a calorie deficit to lose body fat eat at a surplus to gain muscle focus on heavy compound weightlifting.70% of the information in this book can easily be found online if you know where to look.but with the amount of information we have thats false and misleading it can be very challenging.two books i reccomend to compliment this book would be the simple art of bodybuilding by david de las morenas and the bodysculpting bible for men.
customer_reviews.author: cristian

customer_reviews.title: I never write reviews....
customer_reviews.text: But I had to with this book. It is one of the most complete books on nutrition and lifting that I have ever seen. It is the blue print to building the body you wish you always had. It is definitely not for the instant gratification ground. You have to put in the work in the gym and at the dinner table. If you follow the game plan, you can feel confident that the results will be there. Also the customer service from Mr. Matthews and his team is top notch. You can email them any question that you have and they will respond with in a day or two.
customer_reviews.author: Buck Held

customer_reviews.title: I wish somone told me 20 years ago it was this easy
customer_reviews.text: Where was this book 20 years ago? Michael states that his book is nothing new and he is just publishing information that's been out there a while but buried under all the myth and junk. I agree. This book says the same thing that two other books I read in the last 10 years But could not get that diet right. But the way Michael described it, it clicked. Like an aha moment. 24 lbs down and falling, loving my workouts, challenging myself and find losing weight effortless. By tracking my macros I know each week before I get on the scale how much I am going to be down. I can't wait for the bulking phase.
customer_reviews.author: Brett Sanders

customer_reviews.title: Simple, science based approach to working out, eating right and staying motivated!  Mike nailed it!
customer_reviews.text: A friend of mine had a great experience with this book so I bought it. It's exactly what I've been looking for out of a new workout/diet lifestyle. Mike is very simple in the way he lays out the science behind your body, backs things with facts and reports and provides a simple plan for eating, working out and staying focused and determined. It's not cheesy "rah rah" type stuff. I especially like that he's real and reminds you that you'll have mentally tough days but gives you tips and tricks on how to combat those days. I read this book over a weekend... do it!
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: 10 pages dedicated to fitness...
customer_reviews.text: As someone who is already very mindful with nutrition I was disappointed to find the majority of the book was around food with some basic tidbits with regarding body. Only 10 pages involved fitness. I bought the book hoping to learn new ways to work out but even the fitness section was disappointing. It names several workouts which I still had to look up on google because I don't know the names to most things only to find out they were pretty basic stuff as well. Not knocking the information. I was just under the impression this would offer WAY more.
customer_reviews.author: SJ

customer_reviews.title: READ THIS BOOK!
customer_reviews.text: I am a practicing physician and have exercised my whole life. Traditional weights, Crossfit last several years, long distance running, ect. Despite years of health education and working out, I have always been confused about the best regiment/diet to achieve my goals. This book is the answer! Simple, clear, well written, concise, evidence based, and probably the best book on fitness I've ever read. I am doing the One Year Challenge currently (also a highly recommended book) and after 6 months I'm leaner and stronger than I have ever been in my life. I love the workouts and my gains in the gym continue. I'll likely do the Beyond Bigger Learner Stronger program next year.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas

customer_reviews.title: Worth a read, but barely.
customer_reviews.text: Far too much detail to keep the average person interested, and not well laid out at all. Author never provided much info on structuring workouts. He made some very interesting observation and it will leave you questioning what you have been doing in the past. And it will gave you insight on many things to improve results, but then leaves you to your own judgement in the detail of planning future workout. Would I buy it again, yes. But my expectations would be much lower.
customer_reviews.author: EKP

customer_reviews.title: Worth A Read
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this book for my husband. It has a lot of good information in it however I feel it could easily be reduced down to 1/5 of it's size if it didn't self promote itself constantly. It kinda reminds me of a sleezy car salesman because of the constant self promotion on why you need this book. I also purchased Thinner Leaner Stronger for myself. They are practically the same exact book with just a couple of minor differences.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Great insight into how to be leaner
customer_reviews.text: I really like how this book cuts through the science pretty simply and share the relevant information in way that is easy to understand. They have a great workout plan. The reason i have to give this book a 3 star is because ultimately he promotes his own brand and uses a lot of science to back what hes promoting which is cool and all until you realize he is right and that you should go only buy HIS supplement. Right? that where i feel the book is a bit guiding. But overall the science is cool and the explanation are cool and easy to understand.
customer_reviews.author: Caleb

customer_reviews.title: A straightforward, research-backed game plan that works
customer_reviews.text: This book is awesome. It's a straightforward, no-nonsense approach to eating better and getting stronger. No bro-science here -- Mike does his homework and backs up his writing with extensive research (footnotes for days). Plus he offers a plethora of online content, a great podcast and he even responds to emails personally. I always got discouraged and quit when trying to get in shape in the past. When I did go to the gym, I was "winging it" with no real plan for progress. Mike lays out a methodical and easy-to-understand game plan (from workouts to diet to supplements), and I'm already seeing an increase in strength and size in just a couple of weeks.
customer_reviews.author: S. Gallo

customer_reviews.title: Great book and workout plan
customer_reviews.text: Great book and workout plan. The theory behind the workouts really works and I have seen great results along with my own vegetarian ketogenic diet plan.This book has helped change my life. I was always on the chubbier side and no matter how hard I worked out i would get stronger but couldn't seem to get a six pack. Now I have attained my goals and am striving to progress even more. Fitness is not a destination, it is a journey.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: I hate reading more than anyone
customer_reviews.text: First off, I hate reading more than anyone. So I got the audio book and the physical version (to go back and read parts I didn't get at first). This is the first fitness book that actually makes everything sound possible and not have to struggle to achieve my goals. I used to be lean by default but now after getting out of the service, I've gotten a lot fatter. I refuse to be another statistic so I bought this book to and the shredded chef book to do something about it. Thanks Mike for what you do.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: One of the best books on fitness I've read
customer_reviews.text: This third edition is definitely an improvement. Mike has a way of conveying the message with a no BS approach. You can tell he's not basing his knowledge on bro science, but on an extensive research. Some parts of the book get pretty technical without being overwhelming. It's definitely worth a try. The meal plans and workout plans really work, I'm already seeing results and for out of my plateau. Thanks Mike!
customer_reviews.author: Salvador 29

customer_reviews.title: Total waste of time and money
customer_reviews.text: Just a bunch of things you can find anywhere. Don't know why it supposed to be so great. It's a waste of money you can get do better on YouTube. Save your moey
customer_reviews.author: REH

customer_reviews.title: Calories are King!
customer_reviews.text: The one thing many people overlook when dieting are calories. Michael Matthews covers this and is correct High Protein and Low Carbs are great, but you need to count calories. The biggest mistake I was making was not increasing the weights, just the same weights, same routine, with more reps. Thanks Michael, great book.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Book
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the book, read the book , downloaded the bonus package. All this for the price of a couple of coffees at Starbucks. No complaining about value for money , especially the bonus package , very well put together. Now the proof is in the pudding as they say, does it work. Obviously will report back in a couple of months. There is a lot written out there , which one is correct ? Science says X , sometimes it feels like you are getting the latest fad in the golf swing (Leadbetters 200th golf tip). Well will give it a whirl.
customer_reviews.author: rm

customer_reviews.title: The best fitness book I've ever seen.
customer_reviews.text: Comprehensive, informative, thorough, and (best of all) scientifically sound. If you want to learn the SCIENCE behind getting fit, and not have to just take the author's word for it, you need to read this. Heavy citation of peer reviewed studies encourages you to check the sources... and you'll find the research is well done. Mike knows what he's talking about, and legitimy wants to help other men reach (and exceed) their goals. Give this a read, and you will NOT regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well researched with references. Recommended.
customer_reviews.text: I'll add another star if the program actually works :-) Update 2019-02-11: Today is three months into a pretty highly modified version of this program. That's modified to be as kind to my 64-year-old body as I make it and still be following the plan. I've taken many days off when I felt sick, fatigued, or travelled. I've tweaked the diet half a dozen times. In spite of this, I am noticeably stronger and have lost five inches from my waist measurement (from 40 to 35). I've tried a lot of programs over the past decade, this is the first time I've made real progress without getting injured. I plan to continue. Have the Kindle version.
customer_reviews.author: mikeofeconomy

customer_reviews.title: I'll save you some time and money
customer_reviews.text: To sum up the book, you should lift heavy compound movements in the 4 to 6 rep range. 95% of supplements are bogus and don't work (probably true) unless you buy from Michael Matthews, his do work (according to him). If you want to lose weight, eat fewer calories than you are burning. That's really all there is to this book! You are better off buying a Mark Rippetoe book for weightlifting or for general fitness an Alex Hutchinson book.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Bowman

customer_reviews.title: And no book I have come across has laid it out quite as easy to follow as Mike has (and I’ve read a ...
customer_reviews.text: I am a former college athlete with a long history of weight training. It wasn’t until I read BLS that I really grasped the importance of proper nutrition to achieve the ideal results. And no book I have come across has laid it out quite as easy to follow as Mike has (and I’ve read a lot). As a Mark Rippetoe Starting Strength disciple, I have always been big into compound lifting. The BLS workout routine incorporates all of those principles for practical strength into a program that also promotes aesthetic appeal. I would definitely recommend this book.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent health and fitness principles
customer_reviews.text: Awesome workout and book, have made significant strength gains quickly over the past 6 months and several people recently have commented on my gains. I appreciate the levelheaded advice and the scientific research backing the recommendations. I'm feeling better because of the strength gains and also because the "diet" isnt restrictive, so I can eat pretty much whatever I want as long as it fits into the macro numbers. The author is definitely worth modeling in terms of fitness results, so that's a plus too. I can't recommend it highly enough. I already bought a copy for a friend at the gym.
customer_reviews.author: K. Lenoir

customer_reviews.title: Clearer, Simpler, Better - The Real Truth About Mike's Book
customer_reviews.text: Mike is an insightful guy with a grounded, refreshing approach to being healthy as a lifestyle as opposed to typical magazine fodder, rife with trendy new routines. What I enjoyed in particular was his ability to debunk health fads with common sense. It's unbelievable, the amount of misinformation that exists in this industry, all masquerading as the latest breakthrough. Whether your goal is to cut a few pounds and eat a bit healthier, or you want to push the absolute limits of your mind and body, I think you'll find what you need to know in this book. If you don't, Mike will take the time to reply to an email, generally within a few days.
customer_reviews.author: Captain Dipship

customer_reviews.title: Great detail
customer_reviews.text: I am a certified health coach and studying to be a certified personal trainer and fitness nutrition specialist. This book goes into more detail with better work out programs than trainer courses offer. They are aiming for mostly beginners and this book is great if you are serious about taking your own program or that of clients to the next level.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Kaplan

customer_reviews.title: Super excited about this program
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for help with a strength program I recommend this book and this author's podcasts. I liked the author's "down to earth" philosophy and approach to all aspects of fitness. To me the information presented is practical, sensible, realistic, reasonable, rational, science based, balanced and no-nonsense. I have been searching and experimenting with fitness and nutrition information for 15 years. I think I have found my program. I will try to report back a year from now and verify if it is as good as I think it is going to be.
customer_reviews.author: Bahare

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, evidence-based approach for creating a lean, healthy body
customer_reviews.text: This is an outstanding guide for building a lean physique. I've read lots of other guidebooks but this is the best. Mike Matthews has created a complete guide for getting the body you desire. By doing a deep dive into both exercise and nutrition, and creating a simple step-by-step gameplan that anyone can follow, this book is a winner. I'm in the early stages of adding 10-15 lbs of muscle to my lean frame, but if your goal is to lose weight I'm pretty sure this book will be the answer too.
customer_reviews.author: MM

customer_reviews.title: Great book with simple, easy to follow philosophies.
customer_reviews.text: I really appreciate the straight forward approach in this book. Mike breaks things down so anyone can understand it. My copy of the book now looks like a school text book because I've got stickers and bookmarks everywhere with notes all over the pages. I've created my plan that starts Dec. 1 and I will be following closely. I can't wait to see the results of sticking to a tried and proven plan. Mike also has lots of other great content out there, his Muscle for Life podcast contains tons of valuable information and interviews. I highly recommend this book.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Get the book and drink the proverbial cool aid and you will never look back
customer_reviews.text: It has changed my body %100. I had definitely hit a wall in getting bigger and stronger and I did not know why. This book showed me how to get so much stronger and to look shredded. People come up to me now and ask how I look so different. Also, I am not some 20 something meat head, I am a father of 4, doctor of optometry, and almost 40. Big changes came because Michael knows what he is talking about. Get the book and drink the proverbial cool aid and you will never look back!
customer_reviews.author: T-Rav

customer_reviews.title: I'd give it 10 stars if I could.
customer_reviews.text: This is s great book. As a scientist I appreciate that it is fully referenced. Very easy to read. Lots of detail, but has helpful brief summaries at the end of every chapter. This book tells you everything you need to do to get stronger, loose fat and build muscle. I waited to write my review until I tried the program for a while. Now I can say that I followed this program in the book exactly and in 9 weeks I lost 10 pounds and dropped from 20% to 16% body fat. I am going to keep going down to 10% body fat and I have confidence that this program will get me there.
customer_reviews.author: JahStrong

customer_reviews.title: A bit complex, but overall provides what is needed
customer_reviews.text: I’m a fan of this book. I was a kinesiology major in college and was interested on the different strategy’s that trainers like to use. This book definitely has some deeper concepts that is good to know about and slightly understand. But for the average person just starting a gym routine it’s a bit too complex. Overall the book provides a way to calculate the amount of calories you need to consume daily based off what you’re after on body goals. It also provides workouts and breaks them down into sets and reps. If you want to expand your gym knowledge or try to start your own gym routine I would suggest this book.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Spinning wheels? Get this book its a game changer!
customer_reviews.text: By far tops all the information, I've read on fitness! It's a God send in my opinion....I have years of training under my belt and was doing a lot of it wrong! I see gains each week now and weight loss as well! I showed a friend who trains a shot of my abs which would never show and now they are starting to surface and he is very impressed! Dont listen to the negative people and their idiot comments...do yourself a favor and buy this book! Save yourself time and money and a lot of bad fitness junk and do what Michael advises! I will update in a year!
customer_reviews.author: Marty

customer_reviews.title: Great read for all levels
customer_reviews.text: I have always liked how lifting weights made me feel but I always ended up either hurt or making no progress. I’ve always been skinny and just thought I would never have any muscle. I decided to give the weight room one more try and came across this book that claimed to have plans for beginner to advanced alike. I’m now 6 months in, haven’t been injured (just some DOMS) and am stronger than I thought possible. The best part is I got here by doing less than all of my previous attempts. Well worth the read and I’m only using about 20% of what is has to offer so far.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Orscheln

customer_reviews.title: Well Written and Laid Out For Those That Want to Get Started Quickly
customer_reviews.text: Well written book, chock full of good information. I previously read Starting Strength, which is wonderful at laying out the mechanics of the lifts and specifics on the exercises, but I wasn't as interested in strength as looking good, which this book seems to cater to in spades. I'm just starting to implement the routine and the nutrition to what I had been doing, so I can't speak to the results, but the techniques make a lot of sense given what I know about bodybuilding as it jives with the other materials I've read (with, of course, some new wrinkles and techniques that are always backed up by science).
customer_reviews.author: Kurt Miller

customer_reviews.title: Great clarity and single source for such a confusing field!
customer_reviews.text: I have read an awful lot of material on getting bigger and leaner. I have not personally found a "single source" that encompassed so much material in such a rational approach as BLS. I applaud the author for contributing such a level-headed and articulate contribution to a dizzying field that seems to be filled with more vultures feeding on the dead than with living beings. If there are any improvements that could be made, it would be with the kindle formatting. I would like to see more delineations of material throughout, and an index would be great. Fortunately there are great summations at the end of each chapter! Lastly, the author writes great online material as well.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: The Real Deal.
customer_reviews.text: Michael Matthews breaks down the old school training systems and shows a more effective and quicker routine to achieve your goals. It is all laid out in a simple and easy to read book. If you are serious about building some first class muscle on your frame then do yourself a favor and pick up this awesome training manual. He covers all aspects for the natural body builder, including diets and supplements, the good and the bad and what is the honest truth. It really is a great manual that you will want to refer to over and over again.
customer_reviews.author: Gordon Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great book.
customer_reviews.text: I have implemented the information in this book into my life and have received immediate benefits. Read this book about 6 months ago and it changed everything. This is a no BS type of book. This guy is no frills no nothing really just substance. I also have the audible version. His voice is about as deadpan as it gets but the information is clean cut and easy to follow. I also purchased his 1 year challenge workout book and I love it.
customer_reviews.author: James A. Corey

customer_reviews.title: The best book I’ve read on health & fitness
customer_reviews.text: I’ve done much reading on health and fitness over the years, and I can honestly say that Bigger Leaner Stronger is the most informative resource I’ve read. Mike’s utilization of the science behind weight training, cardio, and nutrition was both refreshing and personally encouraging. I’m 72 years old, and I thought Mike covered the concerns that older individuals have, especially when he comes to lifting heavy, developing lean muscle while reducing body fat. I highly recommend this book.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Good concepts but requires a lot of planning.
customer_reviews.text: This book is good but I don't think one size fits everyone's goals. I lobe to lift heavy and train hard but it can be tough on some people that don't like to grind. Regardless there are parts of this that can help people improve their fitness level. This book can be used to guide you to a better you but like all good things you will have to do the work. Lift , plan meals, measure , weigh, record, add, and repeat. Keep Charging !
customer_reviews.author: Jake the snake

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended book.
customer_reviews.text: Is hard to review books for physical trainings as in order to know if they work you have to put in practice what is said. Well, this book is like a thesis, very well thought and researched in a clear language that shows that Michael Matthews has not only knowledge about the ways to achieve perfection in the body but a acute and clear mind. Now some personal issues inhibit me to put in practice the book but while I applied the research I had noticeable and healthy improvements in my body.
customer_reviews.author: Reinold F.

customer_reviews.title: If you're serious about your health and physique, then ...
customer_reviews.text: If you're serious about your health and physique, then do yourself a favor and get this book now. Massive amounts of research, studies, and hands-on experience went into this book, from exercise, to nutrition, supplements, workout myths and marketing BS around supplements. If you're workouts are not producing the results they should (like mine), even though your efforts in the gym are strong, and your nutrition and supplement plan is also strong (so I thought), then it's time for a radical change. This book by Mr. Matthews will give you that radical change; and your body will thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Terry McKenna

customer_reviews.title: Definitely worth a read!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great book for getting on track with your fitness goals. Excellent information on training, diet and fitness in general. I would recommend this to anyone...beginner to advanced. I'm 55 years old, at the time of this writing, and have been doing strength training for almost 3 years. Fitness was always important to me but never did strength training. This book had tons of good information that I truly appreciated learning about.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Complete
customer_reviews.text: Overall: It has all you need inside. Bad (if you can call it that): The exercises section had a bit too much info for my taste, with all those descriptions, but in the end it met its goal: explaining why good form is good and why bad form is dangerous. Good: The meal section was exquisite. Most complete explanation why protein, fibers and carbs exist. I also like the debunked myths of insulin, carbs witch hunting (yes, your body needs carbs) and that of protein absorption in small amounts. Conclusion: Buy it. I bought both the kindle and audio versions, so when I couldn't read, I'd listen to it. I recommend you get yourself the same combo.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandru Okros

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Although I haven't started to apply the vast amounts of advice, principles, and techniques of this book I will say that this books definitely did an amazing job of educating the reader and filtering out the truth from the endless sea of nonsense that is thrown at us all the time by various fitness magazines and other channels. This book has answered every single question that one can have about fitness. And what is said is backed by science. I say give it a try. It's definitely a good book.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing book, simplifies diet and exercise
customer_reviews.text: Awesome book, I’ve been lifting weights since highschool and picked up a lot of bad habits that are discussed in the book and corrected. He really makes it simple and explains diet and exercise I’m a way that shows how simple it can be to get in shape. It’s a great book for beginners to learn proper techniques from the start and for anyone else who is looking to get in the best shape of their lives.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Just finished BLS and am super pumped to get to work
customer_reviews.text: Just finished BLS and am super pumped to get to work. One of the things that immediately impressed me was the depth of research that went into the book. There citation list is endless and full of reputable sources. It also seems pretty safe to assume that Mike actually read these studies as he assesses them fairly and only makes bolder judgements about things that are the most untrue. Everything that you learn in this book will give you a realistic idea of what it takes to build a great body and motivate you to live a healthier lifestyle.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed!
customer_reviews.text: After a few years of designing my diet and workouts based on what I'd see on Instagram, this book was exactly what I needed. Mike lays it all out in a no-nonsense format, debunking a lot of the "newest! latest! greatest!" hype that keeps the fitness and food industries going. As a guy in his 40s looking to crush 50 when it comes, I'm all in with plans laid out Bigger, Leaner, Stronger. Get it. Just get it.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Harris

customer_reviews.title: Very informative
customer_reviews.text: I love the information and backed scientific research packed in this book. It really boasts your confidence even further in what you're doing for yourself when you're so we'll informed with scientific proof. I don't like how the exercises are laid out in this book. Since form is so important and there are so many names for the same exercise, it takes away time from me to look up the exercise to see what in doing. Which means I have to use another source. To fix this very simple issue for newer lifters, I'd suggest simple illustrations by the exercise or an exercise illustration glossary perhaps.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Hendershot

customer_reviews.title: Amazing book. It has helped me understand nutrition
customer_reviews.text: Amazing book. It has helped me understand nutrition. I have lost 70 pounds and achieved my goal from 250 to 180. I have been able to put muscle mass on in a caloric restrictio. Since im a newbie gym rat. The best part is knowing i will never put the weight back on because i fully understand how to gain, maintain, or lose weight. Its a great feeling, and i now offer my help to anyone who is in need of it. Cant say enough good about it
customer_reviews.author: Alf

customer_reviews.title: Overall great book for introductory periods for the new fitness addicts!
customer_reviews.text: This book pretty much gives a basic and fundamental principles of healthy lifestyle. I'm talking about anatomy and physiology, strength training, macro counting, and etc. It gives the entire textbook versions into condensed yet easy-to-read chapters in the narrated book. I highly recommend this book for the beginners and regulars who are looking to truly master the basics and fundamentals of healthy lifestyles.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Good read
customer_reviews.text: It's amazing how few calories are necessary to maintain a healthy weight as described in the book. And it makes sense how difficult it is to lose weight. This book is a plethora of information and includes discussion of the right attitude. I'm counting calories and nutrients again because of it and it is clear that knowledge and discipline are necessary to feel and look better. I recommend the book even if you are well read in the area of exercise and nutrition.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: For beginners and intermediate lifters, but ...
customer_reviews.text: I have been working out for a few years, and consider myself an amateur scholar of the science of swole. That said, I learned some important stuff from this book. Recommended for beginner, intermediate, and old lifters who might want to learn a new thing or two.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Dickman

customer_reviews.title: A science based guide to 'body hacking'
customer_reviews.text: Really, almost a science based guide to 'body hacking'. The exact ways you can change your body how you like without illicit substances or ineffectively long workouts. Mike backs everything up with an extensive bibliography, he does the research so you don't have to. And his writing and communication style are really easy to like. Backed up by almost real time communication on his website if you have any questions or concerns. I've used other "training" guides, and some are great, but this one really consolidates, simplifies, and codifies a simple, clear and robust approach to strength and conditioning training. You can have the body you want, at any age.
customer_reviews.author: David B. Huff

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: This book is great! It tells you everything you need to know to get bigger, leaner, and stronger. It tells you what to do, what not to do, and gives you reasons why. I can't believe the way I was wasting time at the gym! All I--and you--need to do is four exercises! Only four! I've been on the program only 2 months and I've gained size where I want it! Nothing drastic or painful...just common sense exercises. A great book. A great program!
customer_reviews.author: steve

customer_reviews.title: made me feel stupid........ in a good way!
customer_reviews.text: Thanks to this book and the easy strategy. for the 1st time in 20 years I am seeing results thanks to nutrition and correct form advice, kept truthful and simple. It is going to be hard work, no doubt there but if you go in forgetting everything you think you knew, this will be an eye opener. I came to the horrible conclusion, before i used this book and vids found online that I had been benching for 20 years completely incorrectly.....not easy to admit. This has made me look at every excercise i do and start over with corrected form. The difference is night and day in comparison. My wife is using his Thinner, leaner,stronger too. She loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Mark whalley

customer_reviews.title: There is good things to say about the program
customer_reviews.text: I read the book several timed since I purchased it and have been following the guidelines. There is good things to say about the program. I am disappointed that when you go to the web site referred to in the book for nutritional supplements and additional report you cannot download the file. If you read post on the site this seems to be the standard and nobody is able to obtain it. My two stars is a result as this is not very good.
customer_reviews.author: Eddy B

customer_reviews.title: Incredible
customer_reviews.text: This book breaks down everything you would want to know for working out correctly, eating the right way and not being miserable. At the same time, it gives you the motivation & workout plans/exercises to follow while adhering to great macronutrient diets based off body fat %. I highly recommend this to people who are serious about getting lean and fit quickly. I’m 3 weeks in and have already dropped about 5.5 lbs which may sound low, but I’ve built muscle and my waist has gone down from a 36 to a 33/34 that quickly!!
customer_reviews.author: Matt Eakin

customer_reviews.title: The ultimate way to lose weight (that'll make you smarter in the process)
customer_reviews.text: This book is incredible! One of the hardest things about weight loss is that there is so much misinformation about it. This book debunks the gimmicks and gets into the science of eating well and exercising! I had no idea how wrong everything I was doing was! Its great too because it takes you past weight loss and actually to exercises to to maintain your end goal. If you are going to try and get in shape I would recommend this book above all else (and certainly above any blog or internet article)!
customer_reviews.author: Joelle

customer_reviews.title: Great Program
customer_reviews.text: This program is perfect for those of you that want to see results without toiling away in the gym for hours on end. Even though I didn't have consistent gym attendance, this program has still worked amazingly. I could go to the gym for one hour a few times a week and see results with proper nutrition using Mike's methods along with the Stacked app, which I highly recommend. If you cant measure your progress you might as well be doing nothing, and Stacked solved that problem for me. Just adhere to the heavy lifting techniques outlined in the book, eat the proper balance of macronutrients and watch your body and strength transform!
customer_reviews.author: CK

customer_reviews.title: New interesting concepts
customer_reviews.text: This book is very interesting I like the way the chapters has been created into sections where it was easy to navigate and find the information the next time you wish to review them. This book is beneficial for beginners who want to know how to start working out using resistance training also for intermediate and advanced players it is going to be beneficial as well. It has a lot of information regarding nutritions, workouts routines, planning your program, terms concepts, and supplement. The author referenced the research very well which gives the book more credibility.
customer_reviews.author: Mazen AlQarawi

customer_reviews.title: Must Read for Novice and Experienced
customer_reviews.text: Easy read, dispels a lot of workout and dieting myths, and the money you save on useless supplements will more than pay for the book. I first "read" this book as an audiobook, but liked it so much I also bought the printed version for easier reference. You don't need to be a gym rat to benefit from this book, so whether you're a serious bodybuilder or just looking to improve your overall shape (like me), you will benefit from this book.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Good book for the science behind lifting, eating, and getting lean.
customer_reviews.text: Good book overall - the interesting thing was the math/science behind how your body works. Broken down in a very easy way to understand. I started the program in April and will see how results turn out in a few months!
customer_reviews.author: dmd

customer_reviews.title: Not sure where to start? Look no further!
customer_reviews.text: This Book Is absolutely amazing, If you've ever felt lost and not wanting to look stupid at the gym pretending you know what your doing, and praying/hoping no one tries to critic you while you pump out a few, then this is the book for you! couldn't begin to tell you the priceless information in here, I also book Matthews cookbook as well, and they pair amazingly. Not only do I know what I'm doing at the gym, but now no more bland food either, now my meals taste like eating at a good Thai restaurant ( favorite recipe is Thia basil chicken [spicy]) and it's healthy/nutritional.
customer_reviews.author: Xavier

customer_reviews.title: Best Workout Guide Ever...period.  And I’ve tried a lot...
customer_reviews.text: Been working out my whole life...literally in the gym for for 40 years (I’m 55). I’ve tried everything. This is the best book ever for helping you if you want to get “Bigger, Leaner, Stronger.” If you’re like me and have been around the block a few times, it might seem too “simple,” or even too “easy.” But trust me, the results speak for themselves. I’m working out less and getting more. (Not overtraining anymore). Gotta get this book if you’re serious.
customer_reviews.author: MJay

customer_reviews.title: What can I say besides Mike is the best. Mike's books and insight has absolutely changed my ...
customer_reviews.text: What can I say besides Mike is the best. Mike's books and insight has absolutely changed my life. I lifted for about a year; I saw initial progress and then remained stagnant and was very frustrated. I saw the popular reviews of this book, and thought no way it works so well for everyone. After reading the book, I could not have been more wrong. Mike's research and approach to weightlifting is paramount to continuing to progress as a weight lifter. Only 11 weeks into his program I am constantly adding weight to the bar and developing the way I never thought possible. Mike really is the real deal and he genuinely cares about his clients and their progress.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Schwartz

customer_reviews.title: Opened my eyes as to what's important for weight loss and muscle gain
customer_reviews.text: I'm only about 1/2 way through the book but have started using the thoughts to modify my diet. I lost 2 1/2 lbs the first week and don't feel deprived at all. I've also changed my weight lifting from low weights with 20 reps to heavy weights with 5 reps. I can already see some changes in my muscle tone. I'll update this after the first 6 months.
customer_reviews.author: George Lutz

customer_reviews.title: Good information, strong program, awesome author
customer_reviews.text: I have become a big Mike Matthews fan recently as he is one of the few coaches out there who isn’t a religious zealot pushing a particular diet or exercise mythos. For an absolute beginner this book is amazing cover to cover. For someone who has been working out on and off a long time then you can skim the beginning but it’s worth it for the program alone. It include a FULL year of periodized programming. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Christian B

customer_reviews.title: Top Fitness Book
customer_reviews.text: Excellent, we'll researched read on physical fitness. I have started the program and I am really enjoying it and seeing the results. The program is also very reasonable in terms of time at the gym.
customer_reviews.author: Joel Warren McCann

customer_reviews.title: I’ve been on this program for almost 16 weeks and although I haven’t gotten the diet part of it right just yet I’m in the best shape of my life
customer_reviews.text: As a middle aged physician who thought his days of naturally getting the body of his dreams were over...this book shed a lot of light. I was particularly drawn to the science Mike uses to explain the principles in the book. I’ve been on this program for almost 16 weeks and although I haven’t gotten the diet part of it right just yet I’m in the best shape of my life. Two male friends have asked me what program I’m on and one has bought the book as well. I also gifted the female version to a female friend. I highly recommend this book. Thanks for everything, Mike.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well done!
customer_reviews.text: I found this book to be an excellent detailed reference for anyone trying to be the best You that you can be. I particularly liked the fact that the author cites so many studies and research sources to help separate the wheat from the chaff. This book's approach balances diet and exercise, but most importantly isn't heavy handed in its advice. There is also a lot of supportive dialogue from the author to help the reader to understand the strengths and pitfalls of other fitness and diet plans. Well worth the time to invest in yourself!
customer_reviews.author: Jon B

customer_reviews.title: Best book you’ll read on fitness and food
customer_reviews.text: This is the book I wish I’d found 20 years ago. After reading through it once (I say once because you will need to read parts a 2nd and 3rd time) I understood finally what I wasn’t doing right both with eating and working out. I’ve dropped 7 pounds in 12 days and I’ve sold 7 of my friends already on the book, plus my sister. The information in here you won’t get anywhere else. Michael is so inspiring, knowledgeable, and motivates you to make change. This has been my best book purchase .... perhaps ever. Get on board the #biggerleanerstronger train!
customer_reviews.author: Jason Morrell

customer_reviews.title: Title of the book says it all
customer_reviews.text: I have worked out my entire life and considered myself reasonably informed about fitness training. However, after 9 weeks of following Matthews' recommendations for workouts (pretty strictly) and diet (a little more loosely), I'm seeing excellent results. My lifting PRs are increasing weekly (either weight or reps) and my body fat is decreasing at a slow but reasonable pace. I'm curious to see what will happen over the next 2-4 months as PRs likely will become more difficult. But my goals in buying the book were mostly bigger and leaner, and this barbell regimen is delivering very well so far.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Boxa

customer_reviews.title: Do yourself a favor and read this book
customer_reviews.text: This book is fantastic and is a must for anyone looking to improve their physique no matter what experience. Personally I am 19 and have been an athlete my entire life and have been in the gym for 4 years but have never quite had the body that I wanted. Most of what ive learned over the past 4 years when it comes to training has been through YouTube or Instagram and this book really took all the nonsense and confusion out of what I thought I knew and I cant wait to apply what I have learned in the upcoming months. A must read.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I really enjoyed Mike's book
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoyed Mike's book. It's well structured, and answers all of the questions I have about diet and exercise. Most importantly, it's backed by scientific studies. After spending too long on low carb/low weight and high rep workouts, I'm excited to get started on the BLS program and see my results. I also invested in Mike's custom meal plan, hoping that'll help get me the results I've been wanting.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Information! Worth the read!
customer_reviews.text: Definitely worth the read!! Obviously you may have differing opinions just because everyone’s workout style is different. I don’t see eye to eye with his view on supplements but that doesn’t negate how helpful his knowledge is because I’m a lot more conscious of ingredients. And the one year plan he provides is actually pretty solid. Push Pull Legs is a fantastic workout split.
customer_reviews.author: Dez

customer_reviews.title: Everything you need to know about gym and nutrition is there.
customer_reviews.text: I used to follow a bunch of other fitness trainers, but when I read this book I unsubscribed them. This book isn't about selling you anything. Inside there's plenty of research and scientific reasons behind the techniques he's teaching. Nice to read and interesting. 10/10
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great book
customer_reviews.text: Not perfect but a great book. I have read over 50 fitness books the last 20 years and this one is high on my list. Lost some detail towards the end of the book but otherwise it is great. If you have plateaued, this is the book for you. I noticed a difference from other systems after the second week. Follow it carefully and it does work 100%.
customer_reviews.author: David Vaught

customer_reviews.title: A lot of information surrounding the workout
customer_reviews.text: I read the book from cover to cover, all 350 pages or so. I had a co-worker one time who could take the most basic statement and turn it into an all-day discussion. This is kinda how I feel about this book. The plethora of information is good, but the actual workout is only 2-3 pages. I don't want to be a spoiler, but I feel I can summarize the entire book in 3 words - "LIFT HEAVY WEIGHTS".
customer_reviews.author: W White

customer_reviews.title: This is it... if you want all ...
customer_reviews.text: This is it...if you want all the information you need regarding, diet, weight lifting and the science behind it all then your are here. This book is well worth the cost. Michael Matthews goes in depth on everything related to building a lean muscular machine plus a bundle of bonus material. If you are thinking about getting in shape then stop looking and get this.
customer_reviews.author: J Davis

customer_reviews.title: Excellent source if information if you don't mind poor grammar, infomercials and dick jokes.
customer_reviews.text: This book is absolutely a pivotal source of information. One of the finest health and fitness systems available. Expertly tailored for the 21st century and all age levels and body types. It should be in the top 3 books for health and fitness, alas the language, fluidity and character is lacking. If some of the mindful, intensity and focus based advice was applied to the writing in this book, it would be a gold standard. At times it's written like the missing language from a failed Judd Apatow film. Other than that, it's an immense effort with excellent, credible resources and easy to follow, yet detailed resources.
customer_reviews.author: Tashtego

customer_reviews.title: Comprehensive Guide
customer_reviews.text: This book is the best, most comprehensive guide to fitness for men I have ever read. He goes through everything: body science, diet, the mental aspect, weightlifting programs, and so much more! This is for the guy who wants to build a great male body, no matter if you're skinny or fat, his principles apply to everyone and they are all backed by scientific research. I took so much away from the flexible dieting chapter of this book; finally somebody explained how macro-nutrients work in the body! I recommend 100 times out of 100.
customer_reviews.author: Neal

customer_reviews.title: Best fitness and health book out there
customer_reviews.text: My favorite health and fitness book. I have read any and all health and fitness books I come across in the past ten months since I started being more health conscious. Bigger Leaner Stronger is the program that I decided best fits my needs. Mike Matthews did an excellent job on this book and his Muscle for Life website and podcasts serve as a perfect supplement to this book. Speaking of supplements, his Legion brand supplements are top notch as well. Regardless of wether you want to lose weight, build muscle, or just have a general interest in fitness you should really read this book.
customer_reviews.author: Kerry Shy

product_meta.title: Bigger Leaner Stronger: The Simple Science of Building the Ultimate Male Body
